summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019. The sheets are for tiers G, H, J, K, L, and M, documenting scheduled observation rounds for inmates in locked-down status. The document is significant as it represents the standard operating procedure for inmate monitoring at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Routine Inmate Monitoring at MCC New York SHU
events.description: Standard 30-minute observation checks were conducted for inmates in the Special Housing Unit's tiers G, H, J, K, L, and M, as documented on check sheets.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019.
It details the 30-minute observation schedule for inmates held in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), a locked-down status for administrative detention or disciplinary segregation.
The procedure required staff to observe each inmate at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule, with rounds no more than 40 minutes apart.
The sheets cover multiple tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) within the SHU, indicating a standard facility-wide monitoring protocol.
The document is procedural and does not name any specific inmates or staff members, containing only placeholder signature lines.
